results.title: The Isa
results.creator_credit: Andrew J. Helgeson, Cinesound and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: A documentary about Mt Isa produced in 1969. The Isa, 30 minutes. Produced for the Mt. Isa Mines Ltd. Mt. Isa mine and city as seen by business men, tourists and residents enjoying life in this new and ever developing mining city in Northern Queensland.

results.title: The Irrepressible Jack Stone
results.brief_description: A heartbreaking but inspiring story about Jack Stone, the kid who lived every moment of his life to the fullest - as told by his mother. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) in partnership with VicHealth. You can create your won Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or go to www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

results.title: The Iron ladies
results.brief_description: Camp comedy, based on a true story, about a group of gay and transsexual men who join a volleyball team and are led to victory by an unassuming but determined coach. Drawing comic conflict from the protagonists preening and interpersonal problems, the film travels a fairly standard arch regarding tolerance difference and overcoming seemingly insurmountable odds. A huge hit in Thailand, this film also played in numerous festivals, including Toronto Film Festival. Followed by a sequel The Iron ladies 2 in 2003.

results.title: The Iron giant
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Allison Abbate, Des McAnuff and Brad Bird
results.brief_description: A loving homage to fifties science fiction movies, Brad Bird’s animated “The Iron giant” has a strong sense of that era’s unerring innocence mixed with the looming paranoia of the unfamiliar ‘other’. Based on the 1968 children’s story “Iron man” by British poet laureate Ted Hughes, the film’s archetypal story of fear and prejudice depicts the unusual friendship between a nine year old boy called Hogarth Hughes (voiced by Eli Marienthal) and a giant robot that mysteriously lands in small town Maine circa 1958. The town’s suspicious adults greet the enigmatic visitor with open hostility, pushing the young boy into a protective role with the misunderstood giant. When nosy government agents descend upon the town in search of the robot, Hogarth begins to find hiding the car-eating giant a challenging task. Brad Bird laces this wonderful children’s fantasy with a strong political parable about the cold war fear that permeated every aspect of American society and includes a hilarious cartoon version of the now infamous educational film “Duck and cover”. Cast includes: Jennifer Aniston, Harry Connick JR, Vin Diesel, Cloris Leachman, John Mahoney, M. Emmet Walsh, Christopher McDonald.

results.title: The Irishman
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Forest Home Films and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Elizabeth O’Connor. Set in Northern Queensland in the 1920’s, it is the story of a proud Irish Australian teamster and his family as they face the competition from motorised transport. This is the story of a family experiencing events which they cannot control in the face of progress and change. Stars Michael Craig, Simon Burke, Robin Nevin and Bryan Brown.

results.title: The Irish in Australia: Echo of a Distant Drum
results.creator_credit: Orana Films, Michael Balson, Matthew Flanagan and Richard Dennison
results.brief_description: One in three Australians have Irish origins - and this is reflected in the national character. The humour; the sense of self-mockery; ideals of fair play; the dislike of pomp and bombast; the celebration of noble failure; are all characteristics both Irish and Australian. The story of the Irish in Australia has been one of conflict, often echoing dramatic events in Ireland. It’s a history that has been potentially so divisive that it has been ignored. But it is the key to understanding why Australia has become the democratic nation that it is, and yet remains ambivalent on national issues.

results.title: The Irish empire
results.creator_credit: Ritchie Cogan, Hilton Cordell Productions, Little Bird (Dublin), Cafe Productions (London), Alan Gilsenan, David Roberts and Dearbhla Walsh
results.brief_description: Ireland is just a tiny country that has never sought domination, yet it has established Irishness and Irish power bases and communities from Chicago to Vladivistok, from Australia to Argentina. There is no physical empire, but an empire of imagination, a virtual empire, whose followers outnumber the native population in Ireland by over fifteen to one. From a home population of just 4 million, some 70 million people around the world call themselves Irish, or claim Irish descent. This is a thought-provoking exploration of how the Irish have so often triumphed over adversity and established themselves all over the world. It explores the past and present attitudes and ideas which have allowed the Irish people to spread across the world without loosing a sense of identity generations later. Narrated by Fiona Shaw.

results.title: The IQ myth. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: An examination of the ways the IQ concept has been used and misused. It focuses on the question of how much importance should be placed on the test result. This can mean the difference between success or failure in school and adult life, and such exams have been used to categorise entire cultures and races as mentally inferior

results.title: The Ipcress file
results.creator_credit: Harry Saltzman, Rank Film Distributors, Sidney J. Furie and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Based on Len Deighton’s bestseller and produced by Bond films’ Harry Saltzman, this video will be a welcome addition to fans of the world of spies and espionage. Michael Caine stars as British espionage agent Harry Palmer, a cynical and rebellious ex-Army sergeant who has been blackmailed into working for Britain’s secret service. He finds himself caught up in The Ipcress File, a horrifying conspiracy that involves brainwashing, murder, treachery, and implicates involvement at the highest level; M5. Cast includes Michael Caine, Nigel Green, Guy Doleman, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Aubrey Richards.
